title_en: Call for Digital Artist Residency/Submissions: OPEN FEED 2025
excerpt_en: FEED Media Art Center, in partnership with Erie Art Company, invites digital artists from around the globe to participate in OPEN FEED 2025, an exhibi...
content_en:
FEED Media Art Center, in partnership with Erie Art Company, invites digital artists from around the globe to participate in OPEN FEED 2025, an exhibition and residency program exploring the vast landscape of digital art. They welcome submissions of artworks, performances, and workshops that push boundaries, challenge conventions, and engage with the electric pulse of the contemporary world.
The Open FEED 2025 Onsite Residency is an opportunity for media artists to prototype and finish artworks using FEED’s unique resources. Artists are invited to expand their practice in large-scale dedicated studio and exhibition spaces located in a historic 200-year-old building, and explore new skills and techniques with access to FEED’s one-of -a-kind collection of digital and analogue tools and technologies.
content_html:

They welcome submissions of artworks, performances, and workshops that push boundaries, challenge conventions, and engage with the electric pulse of the contemporary world.

The Open FEED 2025 Onsite Residency is an opportunity for media artists to prototype and finish artworks using FEED’s unique resources. Artists are invited to expand their practice in large-scale dedicated studio and exhibition spaces located in a historic 200-year-old building, and explore new skills and techniques with access to FEED’s one-of -a-kind collection of digital and analogue tools and technologies.

title_en: Best in Show - Australian Photographic Dog Prize Campaign
excerpt_en: David Roche Gallery is excited to announce the inaugural Best in Show 2025: Australian Photographic Dog Prize. Established as a biannual prize to cele...
content_en: David Roche Gallery is excited to announce the inaugural Best in Show 2025: Australian Photographic Dog Prize. Established as a biannual prize to celebrate Australian dogs and pay homage to the legacy of their founder, David Roche AM (1930-2013). From David’s famous Fermoy Kennels in North Adelaide his dogs won awards nationally and internationally from the 1950s to the early 2010s. Particularly known for his Afghan Hounds and Kerry Blue Terriers, David holds the record for having won more Best in Shows at Royal Shows than any other Australian. Best in Show 2025: Australian Photographic Dog Prize is open to amateur and professional photographers with a first prize of $5000. The Young photographer category offers a first prize of $500 and the People’s Choice Award $500.
content_html: David Roche Gallery is excited to announce the inaugural Best in Show 2025: Australian Photographic Dog Prize. Established as a biannual prize to celebrate Australian dogs and pay homage to the legacy of their founder, David Roche AM (1930-2013). From David’s famous Fermoy Kennels in North Adelaide his dogs won awards nationally and internationally from the 1950s to the early 2010s. Particularly known for his Afghan Hounds and Kerry Blue Terriers, David holds the record for having won more Best in Shows at Royal Shows than any other Australian. Best in Show 2025: Australian Photographic Dog Prize is open to amateur and professional photographers with a first prize of $5000. The Young photographer category offers a first prize of $500 and the People’s Choice Award $500.

title_en: Northern Beaches Environmental Art and Design Prize
excerpt_en: Entries are now open for the 2025 Northern Beaches Environmental Art & Design Prize. Now in its fifth year, the prize has become one of the leading co...
content_en: Entries are now open for the 2025 Northern Beaches Environmental Art & Design Prize. Now in its fifth year, the prize has become one of the leading competitions for both art and design with an environmental focus. Artists and designers from across Australia, including young people aged 7 to 18 years, are invited to submit work on the theme of the environment. This is your chance to be part of the conversation around climate issues and inspire a sustainable future. Finalists will be featured in an exhibition across our 3 galleries: Manly Art Gallery & Museum, Curl Curl Creative Space and Mona Vale Creative Space Gallery.

content_en: Biennial OPEN exhibition at Quay Arts on the Isle of Wight. Quay Arts invites established and emerging artists across the UK (18+) to submit work exploring the theme SOFT for an OPEN group exhibition. They welcome submissions from all art forms, including multi-disciplinary and digital artists, and other innovative approaches considering the theme. Applicants must be aged 18 or over at the time of applying, based in the UK, and be the creators of the work(s) submitted, or an authorised representative (such as a gallery) of the creator of the work(s).

content_en: The City of Grand Junction and the Grand Junction Commission on Arts and Culture are pleased to announce an opportunity for an artist(s) to create a shade shelter to install along the paved trail. excerpt_en: Summer in New England, is a juried online exhibit will celebrate the spirit of summer across our beautiful region — from coastlines and gardens to tra...
content_en: Summer in New England, is a juried online exhibit will celebrate the spirit of summer across our beautiful region — from coastlines and gardens to trails, skies, and quiet moments of light. We’re inviting Connecticut artists to submit up to five pieces that capture the feeling of summer in New England.40% of any sales from this show will be donated to The Farmington Land Trust to help protect open space.This is an opportunity to share your work with a wider audience while giving back. Selected works will be featured in a curated online gallery, with additional accepted pieces included in a community showcase.
content_html:
Summer in New England, is a juried online exhibit will celebrate the spirit of summer across our beautiful region — from coastlines and gardens to trails, skies, and quiet moments of light. We’re inviting Connecticut artists to submit up to five pieces that capture the feeling of summer in New England.

40% of any sales from this show will be donated to The Farmington Land Trust to help protect open space.

This is an opportunity to share your work with a wider audience while giving back. Selected works will be featured in a curated online gallery, with additional accepted pieces included in a community showcase.

title_en: Series 12 - Curatorial Review Catalogue Publication Edition
excerpt_en:
No application, publication, participation, or selection fees. No fees.
For each catalogue edition, up to six artists are selected for detailed curato...
content_en:
No application, publication, participation, or selection fees. No fees.
For each catalogue edition, up to six artists are selected for detailed curatorial review essays, written by the curator. How to apply:​
Email your CV, 3 image samples, and artist website to [email protected]
​Artist Feature Catalogue articles are published on the AFA website at https://www.aedrafinearts.com/afcatalogue , Substack page at https://aedrafinearts.substack.com , and in linen wrap hardcover book editions. ​​What is 'the catalogue'?The AFA Catalogue is not a magazine but rather a collection of scholarly essays published in a hardcover artbook format as well as presented digitally in a manner similar to an exhibition catalogue. Only prize winners from AFA edition competitions are included in all formats of the catalogue, digitally and in print. The catalogue includes artists who have works in the permanent collections of the Museum of Modern Art, the Whitney Museum of American Art, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Artists included in the catalogue have also been critically published by the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Forbes, National Geographic, Financial Times, Newsweek, and The Guardian. There are also quite a few artists in the catalogue who are represented by some of the most respected galleries in the world. AFA editions include notable award achievers such as National Endowment for the Arts and Pollock-Krasner Foundation grant recipients as well as International Photography Awards (IPA) winners.
content_html:
No application, publication, participation, or selection fees. No fees.
For each catalogue edition, up to six artists are selected for detailed curatorial review essays, written by the curator.

How to apply:​
Email your CV, 3 image samples, and artist website to [email protected]
​
Artist Feature Catalogue articles are published on the AFA website at https://www.aedrafinearts.com/afcatalogue , Substack page at https://aedrafinearts.substack.com , and in linen wrap hardcover book editions.
​​
What is 'the catalogue'?
The AFA Catalogue is not a magazine but rather a collection of scholarly essays published in a hardcover artbook format as well as presented digitally in a manner similar to an exhibition catalogue. Only prize winners from AFA edition competitions are included in all formats of the catalogue, digitally and in print. The catalogue includes artists who have works in the permanent collections of the Museum of Modern Art, the Whitney Museum of American Art, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Artists included in the catalogue have also been critically published by the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Forbes, National Geographic, Financial Times, Newsweek, and The Guardian. There are also quite a few artists in the catalogue who are represented by some of the most respected galleries in the world. AFA editions include notable award achievers such as National Endowment for the Arts and Pollock-Krasner Foundation grant recipients as well as International Photography Awards (IPA) winners.

excerpt_en: The Lumen Prize is now accepting submissions for its 2025 edition, inviting digital artists from around the globe to submit their most innovative and ...
content_en: The Lumen Prize is now accepting submissions for its 2025 edition, inviting digital artists from around the globe to submit their most innovative and groundbreaking works. With a total prize pool of $30,000, including the prestigious Lumen Prize Gold Award of $12,000, the Lumen Prize offers a platform for artists to showcase their work and gain recognition on an international stage. Now in its 14th year, the Lumen Prize continues to honor exceptional works created with technology, spanning diverse artistic practices. Submissions are welcomed in nine categories, including Still Image, Moving Image, Performance & Music, Hybrid (Digital/Physical), Experiential, and more. In addition to individual awards, the Gold Award recognizes the overall best artwork across all categories.
content_html: The Lumen Prize is now accepting submissions for its 2025 edition, inviting digital artists from around the globe to submit their most innovative and groundbreaking works. With a total prize pool of $30,000, including the prestigious Lumen Prize Gold Award of $12,000, the Lumen Prize offers a platform for artists to showcase their work and gain recognition on an international stage. Now in its 14th year, the Lumen Prize continues to honor exceptional works created with technology, spanning diverse artistic practices. Submissions are welcomed in nine categories, including Still Image, Moving Image, Performance & Music, Hybrid (Digital/Physical), Experiential, and more. In addition to individual awards, the Gold Award recognizes the overall best artwork across all categories.

excerpt_en: Invoke & Imbibe is a powerful exploration of feminine power and ecstatic transformation, drawing inspiration from the frenzied, experiential rituals o...
content_en:
Invoke & Imbibe is a powerful exploration of feminine power and ecstatic transformation, drawing inspiration from the frenzied, experiential rituals of the Maenads—the wild followers of Dionysus.
This communal experience invites artists to submit paintings, prints, archival photography, small sculptures and mixed media works that embody indulgence, mysticism, and rebellion. This exhibition celebrates the untamed spirit and transformative power of feminine energy, urging artists to embrace and express their own fierce, unapologetic femininity. Through a captivating blend of art and interactive exhibition programming, Invoke & Imbibe invites attendees to revel in hedonism and summon the goddess within. Join them to create an experience that is as intoxicating and transformative as the myths that inspired it.
content_html:
Invoke & Imbibe is a powerful exploration of feminine power and ecstatic transformation, drawing inspiration from the frenzied, experiential rituals of the Maenads—the wild followers of Dionysus.

This communal experience invites artists to submit paintings, prints, archival photography, small sculptures and mixed media works that embody indulgence, mysticism, and rebellion. This exhibition celebrates the untamed spirit and transformative power of feminine energy, urging artists to embrace and express their own fierce, unapologetic femininity. Through a captivating blend of art and interactive exhibition programming, Invoke & Imbibe invites attendees to revel in hedonism and summon the goddess within. Join them to create an experience that is as intoxicating and transformative as the myths that inspired it.

title_en: Young European Artist Trieste Contemporanea Award (YEATCA)
excerpt_en: Trieste Contemporanea is pleased to announce that the 2025 edition of the Young European Artist Trieste Contemporanea Award YEATCA is now open! Deadli...
content_en: Trieste Contemporanea is pleased to announce that the 2025 edition of the Young European Artist Trieste Contemporanea Award YEATCA is now open! Deadline: 25 May 2025 at 11:59 pm (italian time) The YEATCA is open to artists under 30 who were born in one of the following countries: Albania, Austria, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Estonia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Kosovo, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Ukraine. The winner will be invited to plan a solo exhibition in Trieste, opening at Studio Tommaseo in December 2025. The exhibition production budget includes: curatorial support and exhibition catalog publication; travel and accommodation expenses for the artist to attend the installation and opening.

The winner will be invited to plan a solo exhibition in Trieste, opening at Studio Tommaseo in December 2025. The exhibition production budget includes: curatorial support and exhibition catalog publication; travel and accommodation expenses for the artist to attend the installation and opening.

excerpt_en: The Canopy Residency presented by NYC Crit Club, will grant one artist a free private studio in Chelsea (NYC) for 4-weeks in August to develop a body ...
content_en:
The Canopy Residency presented by NYC Crit Club, will grant one artist a free private studio in Chelsea (NYC) for 4-weeks in August to develop a body of work & host studio visits! The Canopy Resident will receive: 4 weeks at The Canopy Program Studio: a free, large (550 sq. ft.), and private space, with 24/7 access. Located in the heart of Chelsea, NYC, a studio visit with juror + curator Natalia Viera Salgado, open studio event at end of residency, artist feature on The Canopy Program/NYC Crit Club website and Instagram, and a $75 Blick Gift Card for Blick Art Materials.
Please note: This opportunity *does not* include housing or cover travel and food expenses.

content_en: GranburyArts, the Granbury Cultural Arts Commission, is currently inviting local artists to submit images of their original artwork for potential selection in a catalog of art. This catalog will serve as a resource for various public art projects in our community, including utility box wraps, mosaic windows, murals, sculptures, and other visual arts in public buildings and parks. They welcome a broad range of media for the catalog, including paintings, photo­graphy, collages, sculptures, mosaics, and more. This is an incredible opportunity to have your artwork featured in public spaces and contribute to the artistic vibrancy of our city.

excerpt_en: Glasgow International is a biennial festival with a history of celebrating the unique depth and long-standing vibrancy of Glasgow's contemporary arts ...
content_en: Glasgow International is a biennial festival with a history of celebrating the unique depth and long-standing vibrancy of Glasgow's contemporary arts scene. Since the first edition in 2005, Glasgow International has evolved and adapted to the changing needs of the community of artists and arts organisations in the city, while connecting artists and audiences internationally and nationally. Building on the 2024 edition of the festival, the development of Glasgow International and its presence in the city will continue to centre the ethos of collective endeavour.

Since the first edition in 2005, Glasgow International has evolved and adapted to the changing needs of the community of artists and arts organisations in the city, while connecting artists and audiences internationally and nationally. Building on the 2024 edition of the festival, the development of Glasgow International and its presence in the city will continue to centre the ethos of collective endeavour.

excerpt_en: Sanchez Art Center (SAC) invites California artists (18+) to submit an entry to participate in the 50|50 Show. This annual event — in its 17th year — ...
content_en: Sanchez Art Center (SAC) invites California artists (18+) to submit an entry to participate in the 50|50 Show. This annual event — in its 17th year — is a renowned celebration of artist creativity and perseverance. Artists create 50 small works (6” x 6”) over the course of 50 days. The exhibition of the artworks will run Sept 5 – Oct 5, 2025. Each artist chooses a (10 word or less) theme for all 50 pieces. Creation of works by participating artists will begin Mon, June 23 and end Mon, Aug 11, 2025. Entries must be submitted online by 10:59 pm Pacific Daylight Time.

excerpt_en: Presenting Art Collide’s "Open Theme”, Summer 2025, international competition and online exhibition. Artists of all ages from around the world are inv...
content_en:
Presenting Art Collide’s "Open Theme”, Summer 2025, international competition and online exhibition. Artists of all ages from around the world are invited to participate, with complete freedom in choosing their preferred media and style. The competition's theme is "Open," allowing participants to express their creativity by submitting artworks on any subject matter of their choice. Only artists whose works are selected as finalists will be required to pay a $35 participation fee. Finalists will have their artwork showcased online and advance to the final round of judging, where they will be considered for cash prizes, including the chance to win the grand prize of $1,000.
Open-themed art contests encompass a broad spectrum of visual arts, spanning painting, drawing, sculpture, photography, digital art, and more.

title_en: Pensychnant Conservation Centre Open Art Exhibition 2025: Natu...
excerpt_en: Pensychnant Conservation Centre and Nature Reserve conserves and celebrates nature within the cultural landscape – past, present and future. 150 acres...
content_en: Pensychnant Conservation Centre and Nature Reserve conserves and celebrates nature within the cultural landscape – past, present and future. 150 acres of outstanding natural beauty at the top of Sychnant Pass, above Conwy, North Wales is managed as a nature reserve for the benefit of its wildlife and for the peaceful appreciation of nature. The theme for the Pensychnant Conservation Centre Open 2025 will be Nature, Environment and Conservation. They welcome 2 and 3 dimensional artworks in any medium or style. All proceeds from the exhibition will go to the upkeep and development of Pensychnant, and the conservation of its habitats and wildlife.

The theme for the Pensychnant Conservation Centre Open 2025 will be Nature, Environment and Conservation. They welcome 2 and 3 dimensional artworks in any medium or style. All proceeds from the exhibition will go to the upkeep and development of Pensychnant, and the conservation of its habitats and wildlife.

excerpt_en: Color is a fundamental element of artistic expression that transcends language and culture. It empowers artists to convey emotion, energy, and meaning...
content_en: Color is a fundamental element of artistic expression that transcends language and culture. It empowers artists to convey emotion, energy, and meaning. Artists use color to create an atmosphere, direct the viewer’s eye, and make a lasting impact. The psychology of color in art is a rich and complex field, and color is an invaluable tool for artists. Artists working in all mediums are invited to submit works where color is a powerful tool of artistic expression. All original artwork that follows the guidelines is eligible for this Maryland Federation of Art’s (MFA) show. Open to all artists residing in North America and the surrounding territories. Works selected by the juror will be on display in MFA’S Circle Gallery.

excerpt_en: Tulsa Artist Fellowship is a place-based, durational award that aims to support visionary arts practitioners. Realizing George Kaiser Family Foundatio...
content_en: Tulsa Artist Fellowship is a place-based, durational award that aims to support visionary arts practitioners. Realizing George Kaiser Family Foundation’s vision grounded in social change, Tulsa Artist Fellowship is committed to fostering an environment where a visionary community of artists and arts workers have the opportunity to thrive. For the 2026-2028 term, awardees will each receive a total stipend of $150,000 stipend paid over three-years for awarded project deliverables and general artistic practice costs, along with a $12,000 yearly housing stipend, $1,200 yearly health and wellness stipend, $1,200 yearly studio assistant stipend, $1,500 one-time studio move-in stipend, fully-subsidized studio spaces, and access to shared art-making facilities, and more.

For the 2026-2028 term, awardees will each receive a total stipend of $150,000 stipend paid over three-years for awarded project deliverables and general artistic practice costs, along with a $12,000 yearly housing stipend, $1,200 yearly health and wellness stipend, $1,200 yearly studio assistant stipend, $1,500 one-time studio move-in stipend, fully-subsidized studio spaces, and access to shared art-making facilities, and more.

title_en: Sloss Metal Arts Visiting Artist in Residence - Fall
excerpt_en: Currently seeking 2025 Visiting Artists! Sloss Furnaces Foundation hosts three, 8-week Visiting Artists throughout the year, typically in the Summer (...
content_en: Currently seeking 2025 Visiting Artists! Sloss Furnaces Foundation hosts three, 8-week Visiting Artists throughout the year, typically in the Summer (June-Aug) and Fall (Sept-Nov). This program is designed for artists interested in developing their studio practice and honing technical skills. Visiting Artists will be provided with a furnished apartment near Sloss Furnaces, casting materials, and 24-hour studio access in Sloss' historic casting shed. Visiting Artists are expected to have a final exhibition at The 600 at the conclusion of their residency. The majority of the work is to be displayed for up to a year, with the option to sell throughout the exhibition. Artists are expected to donate one piece from their residency to Sloss Furnaces' permanent collection.

excerpt_en: The Painting Center is seeking submissions for the juried group exhibition Turned and Turning Still curated by Kellie Lehr, Jamie Powell and Lisa Petk...
content_en: The Painting Center is seeking submissions for the juried group exhibition Turned and Turning Still curated by Kellie Lehr, Jamie Powell and Lisa Petker Mintz. The exhibition will be on view from June 24 - July 19, 2025, and will be featured on Artsy. Turned and Turning Still invites work that honors transformation and material experimentation, exploring the act of becoming, where materials, techniques, and subjects are always in motion and always turning still. All visual art styles and mediums will be considered for this exhibition. The deadline to apply is May 30, 2025.

excerpt_en: The City of Grand Junction and the Grand Junction Commission on Arts and Culture are seeking an artist and/or graphic designer to create an original m...
content_en: The City of Grand Junction and the Grand Junction Commission on Arts and Culture are seeking an artist and/or graphic designer to create an original mural design for the Natatorium at the new Community Recreation Center. The design should include water elements and utilize the color palette in the site details of this call. The final submission will be a digital design file that will be printed and installed by another vendor.
content_html: The City of Grand Junction and the Grand Junction Commission on Arts and Culture are seeking an artist and/or graphic designer to create an original mural design for the Natatorium at the new Community Recreation Center. The design should include water elements and utilize the color palette in the site details of this call. The final submission will be a digital design file that will be printed and installed by another vendor.

excerpt_en: Red Willow Art celebrates Spring (in the Northern Hemisphere) and Fall (in the Southern Hemisphere) with a call for entry for an international competi...
content_en:
Red Willow Art celebrates Spring (in the Northern Hemisphere) and Fall (in the Southern Hemisphere) with a call for entry for an international competition and virtual exhibition. Artists (18 years or older) worldwide are invited to participate, with complete freedom in choosing their medium and style. Submissions should revolve around the central theme of “Lovin’ the Landscape!”
Artwork selected by the jury will be featured on the Red Willow Art website. Finalists will have their artwork showcased in a curated online exhibition at the end of the year (winner and finalists featured in their blog too). The Grand Finale Salon winner will be a Featured Artist on the Red Willow Art website. Finalists will advance to the final jurying round (Grand Finale Salon) in consideration of cash prizes and the opportunity to win the grand prize of $1000.

excerpt_en: East Quay is pleased to offer a 6-week residency to a South West based artist in their sought-after Studio 10 Project Space. They are accepting applic...
content_en: East Quay is pleased to offer a 6-week residency to a South West based artist in their sought-after Studio 10 Project Space. They are accepting applications from artists working in all mediums.‍ Studio 10 Project Space helps them build connections with the local community through introducing their audiences to new mediums, artworks, and wider contemporary practice. It provides them with the space to platform emerging and underrepresented artists as part of their wider exhibition programme and encourages open conversations about different ways of creating and experiencing art.

It provides them with the space to platform emerging and underrepresented artists as part of their wider exhibition programme and encourages open conversations about different ways of creating and experiencing art.

title_en: Residency programme Vila 31 - Art Explora, 2026 Sessions
excerpt_en: Nested in the heart of a dynamic city, Tirana Art Residency – Vila 31 x Art Explora aims to support contemporary creation in all its forms, within a t...
content_en: Nested in the heart of a dynamic city, Tirana Art Residency – Vila 31 x Art Explora aims to support contemporary creation in all its forms, within a transdisciplinary and transgenerational perspective. Opened in January 2025, Vila 31 x Art Explora runs a dynamic cultural programme in collaboration with local stakeholders, institutions, schools, and associations, including exhibitions, workshops, film screenings, discussions, and festivals open to all. Each resident benefits from: A 3 months residency in Vila 31, in Tirana, a studio-apartment (only one double bed), fully equipped and furnished, a grant of 800 euros per month, a production grant of up to 1,500 euros, and a round trip to the residence.

Each resident benefits from: A 3 months residency in Vila 31, in Tirana, a studio-apartment (only one double bed), fully equipped and furnished, a grant of 800 euros per month, a production grant of up to 1,500 euros, and a round trip to the residence.

title_en: Call for Art: Lightness of Being – A Global Virtual Exhibition...
excerpt_en:
A Global Virtual Exhibition and Artist Catalog
Create! Magazine invites artists worldwide to submit work for Lightness of Being, an international virt...
content_en:
A Global Virtual Exhibition and Artist Catalog
Create! Magazine invites artists worldwide to submit work for Lightness of Being, an international virtual group exhibition and professionally designed print and digital catalog juried by internationally renowned artist, curator, and educator Sergio Gomez.
This exhibition explores the concept of lightness—whether emotional, spiritual, physical, or metaphorical.
Accepted Mediums: Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Photography, Fiber and Textile Art, Digital Art, Mixed Media, Collage, Installation (for catalog representation only)
Selected Artists Will Receive: Inclusion in the Lightness of Being virtual group exhibition, A two-page spread in the Lightness of Being print and digital catalog, A curatorial statement by Sergio Gomez, A spotlight feature on the Create! Magazine blog, and Social media promotion
content_html:
A Global Virtual Exhibition and Artist Catalog

Create! Magazine invites artists worldwide to submit work for Lightness of Being, an international virtual group exhibition and professionally designed print and digital catalog juried by internationally renowned artist, curator, and educator Sergio Gomez.

This exhibition explores the concept of lightness—whether emotional, spiritual, physical, or metaphorical.

Accepted Mediums: Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Photography, Fiber and Textile Art, Digital Art, Mixed Media, Collage, Installation (for catalog representation only)

Selected Artists Will Receive: Inclusion in the Lightness of Being virtual group exhibition, A two-page spread in the Lightness of Being print and digital catalog, A curatorial statement by Sergio Gomez, A spotlight feature on the Create! Magazine blog, and Social media promotion

excerpt_en: The [R.E. Award 2025] is a residency art award designed to support diverse artistic practices and creators. The R.E. Award 2025 provides opportunities...
content_en: The [R.E. Award 2025] is a residency art award designed to support diverse artistic practices and creators. The R.E. Award 2025 provides opportunities for artists and collectives with an established practice to deepen their engagement with new contexts. Through exhibitions, residencies, events, and workshops, they have fostered exchanges between artists, communities, and places. This year, their initiative is jointly organized by ASP (Yogyakarta, Indonesia) and hazi (Aichi, Japan). They invite artists to position themselves within a "three-point perspective," with their current location as one of the observation points, alongside ASP and hazi. By reconsidering borders—both conceptual and physical—they hope this award will serve as a catalyst for new artistic expressions that extend beyond personal and geographical.
content_html: The [R.E. Award 2025] is a residency art award designed to support diverse artistic practices and creators. The R.E. Award 2025 provides opportunities for artists and collectives with an established practice to deepen their engagement with new contexts. Through exhibitions, residencies, events, and workshops, they have fostered exchanges between artists, communities, and places. This year, their initiative is jointly organized by ASP (Yogyakarta, Indonesia) and hazi (Aichi, Japan). They invite artists to position themselves within a "three-point perspective," with their current location as one of the observation points, alongside ASP and hazi. By reconsidering borders—both conceptual and physical—they hope this award will serve as a catalyst for new artistic expressions that extend beyond personal and geographical.

excerpt_en: The [r.e. award 2025] is an exhibition-based art award designed to support diverse artistic practices and creators, encouraging experimental and bound...
content_en: The [r.e. award 2025] is an exhibition-based art award designed to support diverse artistic practices and creators, encouraging experimental and boundary-pushing projects. They invite artists to position themselves within a "three-point perspective," with their current location as one of the observation points, alongside ASP and hazi. By reconsidering borders—both conceptual and physical—they hope this award will serve as a catalyst for new artistic expressions that extend beyond personal and geographical boundaries. Artists receive a residency opportunity of approximately one month at either ASP, hazi, or both, providing space for research, experimentation, and artistic production. At the end of the residency artists will have the opportunity to make some kind of presentation, such as an exhibition or workshop.

excerpt_en: Every year, ArtPrize transforms Grand Rapids, MI into a citywide gallery, showcasing the work of artists and designers from around the world. It’s mor...
content_en:
Every year, ArtPrize transforms Grand Rapids, MI into a citywide gallery, showcasing the work of artists and designers from around the world. It’s more than just an art competition with $600,000 in awards and prizes—it’s a platform to be seen, make connections, and share your work!
This year’s event runs September 18 – October 4, and they’re looking for bold, imaginative work in all forms.
content_html:
Every year, ArtPrize transforms Grand Rapids, MI into a citywide gallery, showcasing the work of artists and designers from around the world. It’s more than just an art competition with $600,000 in awards and prizes—it’s a platform to be seen, make connections, and share your work!

This year’s event runs September 18 – October 4, and they’re looking for bold, imaginative work in all forms.

excerpt_en: The 8th Annual PROUD+ Exhibition will be held July 3 - August 2, 2025, during San Diego Pride Month, showcasing the work of LGBTQ+ artists from across...
content_en: The 8th Annual PROUD+ Exhibition will be held July 3 - August 2, 2025, during San Diego Pride Month, showcasing the work of LGBTQ+ artists from across the country. Produced by The Studio Door, this national exhibition celebrates the unique perspectives and voices of the LGBTQ+ community through contemporary art. For nearly a decade, PROUD+ has provided a vital platform for LGBTQ+ artists to express their creativity, identity, and lived experiences. From bold declarations of self to quiet explorations of inner worlds, this exhibition seeks to highlight the richness and diversity of LGBTQ+ life and culture. Artists are invited to submit works that reflect their own interpretations of pride, resilience, and community.

For nearly a decade, PROUD+ has provided a vital platform for LGBTQ+ artists to express their creativity, identity, and lived experiences. From bold declarations of self to quiet explorations of inner worlds, this exhibition seeks to highlight the richness and diversity of LGBTQ+ life and culture. Artists are invited to submit works that reflect their own interpretations of pride, resilience, and community.

excerpt_en: In 2021, DVAA expanded their Fellowship by adding a Studio Residency program. This program was created to support underrepresented artists from a dive...
content_en: In 2021, DVAA expanded their Fellowship by adding a Studio Residency program. This program was created to support underrepresented artists from a diverse range of backgrounds, ages, and experience levels at pivotal stages in the development of their artistic practices. Each Resident receives one month of 24/7 studio access in the residency space at DVAA, support from the DVAA staff throughout their residency year, and a year of professional development opportunities alongside the rest of the Fellowship and Residency Cohort. Must be Over 18 and planning to live in the greater Philadelphia region during the full year of the program.

This program was created to support underrepresented artists from a diverse range of backgrounds, ages, and experience levels at pivotal stages in the development of their artistic practices. Each Resident receives one month of 24/7 studio access in the residency space at DVAA, support from the DVAA staff throughout their residency year, and a year of professional development opportunities alongside the rest of the Fellowship and Residency Cohort. Must be Over 18 and planning to live in the greater Philadelphia region during the full year of the program.

excerpt_en: DVAA is now accepting applications for our 2025 Fellowship program. Inspired by the vision of DVAA’s founders to provide a creative refuge for margina...
content_en: DVAA is now accepting applications for our 2025 Fellowship program. Inspired by the vision of DVAA’s founders to provide a creative refuge for marginalized artists, the DVAA Fellowship Program was created in 2018 to better serve the DVAA Membership and the arts communities of Philadelphia. They annually support underserved artists with innovative ideas through four distinct Fellowship tracks. Fellows accepted into the program are encouraged to develop and pursue experimental concepts and themes within their exhibition with the support of DVAA staff and resources. Must be Over 18 and planning to live in the greater Philadelphia region during the full year of the program.
content_html: DVAA is now accepting applications for our 2025 Fellowship program. Inspired by the vision of DVAA’s founders to provide a creative refuge for marginalized artists, the DVAA Fellowship Program was created in 2018 to better serve the DVAA Membership and the arts communities of Philadelphia. They annually support underserved artists with innovative ideas through four distinct Fellowship tracks. Fellows accepted into the program are encouraged to develop and pursue experimental concepts and themes within their exhibition with the support of DVAA staff and resources. Must be Over 18 and planning to live in the greater Philadelphia region during the full year of the program.

title_en: Doorkeeper Art Zine Calls for Submissions
excerpt_en: The launch of The Doorkeeper, a new art zine dedicated to exploring the intersection of art, philosophy, and poetry, has been announced. Submissions a...
content_en:
The launch of The Doorkeeper, a new art zine dedicated to exploring the intersection of art, philosophy, and poetry, has been announced. Submissions are currently open to artists, writers, philosophers, and poets for upcoming issues, inviting creatives to participate in this exciting journey.
The zine welcomes submissions that creatively engage with these themes through visual art, essays, and poetry. Whether emerging or established, all creatives are encouraged to share their unique perspectives.
Each issue of The Doorkeeper has a theme, so please ensure that your submission aligns with the current theme.
content_html:
The launch of The Doorkeeper, a new art zine dedicated to exploring the intersection of art, philosophy, and poetry, has been announced. Submissions are currently open to artists, writers, philosophers, and poets for upcoming issues, inviting creatives to participate in this exciting journey.

The zine welcomes submissions that creatively engage with these themes through visual art, essays, and poetry. Whether emerging or established, all creatives are encouraged to share their unique perspectives.
Each issue of The Doorkeeper has a theme, so please ensure that your submission aligns with the current theme.

title_en: Parklane Gallery 33rd Annual International Juried Miniature Show
excerpt_en: Miniature art is fine art on a small scale, with minute attention to detail, which can be enlarged or withstand close inspection without revealing fau...
content_en: Miniature art is fine art on a small scale, with minute attention to detail, which can be enlarged or withstand close inspection without revealing faults. Non-representational work such as abstracts may meet the spirit of a miniature if all other factors in the definition of a miniature are met. 3D art is welcome. Digital art and photography is not accepted for this show.
content_html: Miniature art is fine art on a small scale, with minute attention to detail, which can be enlarged or withstand close inspection without revealing faults. Non-representational work such as abstracts may meet the spirit of a miniature if all other factors in the definition of a miniature are met. 3D art is welcome. Digital art and photography is not accepted for this show.

excerpt_en: The Olympic Heritage | Artists in Residence programme provides artists with a unique experience and unparalleled access to museum collections, mentors...
content_en:
The Olympic Heritage | Artists in Residence programme provides artists with a unique experience and unparalleled access to museum collections, mentorship, expert support and resources to create innovative, boundary-pushing digital art inspired by Olympic history.
Two artists will be selected by an esteemed and prestigious international jury for a two-month residency. The resulting artworks and artists’ digital diaries (films) will be selected and accessioned into the permanent collections of QOSM (Doha residency) and the Olympic Museum (Swiss residency), as part of a growing body of Olympic art in each institution.
Their international jury will assess artists' proposals based on their creativity, technical skill, and the strength of their ideas to redefine sports culture through digital innovation.
content_html:
The Olympic Heritage | Artists in Residence programme provides artists with a unique experience and unparalleled access to museum collections, mentorship, expert support and resources to create innovative, boundary-pushing digital art inspired by Olympic history.
Two artists will be selected by an esteemed and prestigious international jury for a two-month residency. The resulting artworks and artists’ digital diaries (films) will be selected and accessioned into the permanent collections of QOSM (Doha residency) and the Olympic Museum (Swiss residency), as part of a growing body of Olympic art in each institution.
Their international jury will assess artists' proposals based on their creativity, technical skill, and the strength of their ideas to redefine sports culture through digital innovation.

excerpt_en: This exhibition seeks to merge Afrocentrism—a worldview that recenters people of African descent in historical, cultural, and artistic narratives—with...
content_en: This exhibition seeks to merge Afrocentrism—a worldview that recenters people of African descent in historical, cultural, and artistic narratives—with eclecticism, an approach that embraces diverse influences, styles, and mediums. Inspired by Molefi Asante’s philosophy of reclaiming African diasporic identity, this exhibition creates a space for BIPOC artists to explore, celebrate, and challenge perceptions of Blackness across time, space, and artistic expression. Artists working in all mediums are invited to submit works that reflect the depth and multiplicity of Black diasporic identities—seen and unseen, shared and personal, historical and futuristic. This exhibition encourages a dialogue on how Blackness is experienced, imagined, and expressed across different cultural landscapes.
content_html: This exhibition seeks to merge Afrocentrism—a worldview that recenters people of African descent in historical, cultural, and artistic narratives—with eclecticism, an approach that embraces diverse influences, styles, and mediums. Inspired by Molefi Asante’s philosophy of reclaiming African diasporic identity, this exhibition creates a space for BIPOC artists to explore, celebrate, and challenge perceptions of Blackness across time, space, and artistic expression. Artists working in all mediums are invited to submit works that reflect the depth and multiplicity of Black diasporic identities—seen and unseen, shared and personal, historical and futuristic. This exhibition encourages a dialogue on how Blackness is experienced, imagined, and expressed across different cultural landscapes.

title_en: Still Life: Beyond the Ordinary Art Competition

content_en: Transform the familiar, into the extraordinary with Still Life: Beyond the Ordinary theme! title_en: Jonathan and Barbara Silver Foundation 2025 Grant for Sculpture
excerpt_en: In this grant program, the Jonathan and Barbara Silver Foundation’s goal is to encourage and support sculptors as well as writers on sculpture, both e...
content_en:
In this grant program, the Jonathan and Barbara Silver Foundation’s goal is to encourage and support sculptors as well as writers on sculpture, both emerging and established.
The JBSF offers one $20,000 grant per year.
The JBSF grant program operates on a 2-year cycle with alternating grants that support writing in even years and sculpture in odd years. Applications are now open for the sculpture grant. The next writing grant application will be available in 2026.
Funds will go toward creating a work or a body of work that is essential to the artist’s development and a contribution to sculpture as a field.
The sculpture grant is specifically for an artist who demonstrates an exceptional commitment to sculpture that includes an informed and imaginative engagement with its materials, histories, and situation.
The writing grant is specifically for a writer who generates fresh writing and thinking on the history, aesthetics, purposes, imagination or situation of sculpture.
The grant recipient is expected to complete the project within one year of receiving the award.
content_html:
In this grant program, the Jonathan and Barbara Silver Foundation’s goal is to encourage and support sculptors as well as writers on sculpture, both emerging and established.

Funds will go toward creating a work or a body of work that is essential to the artist’s development and a contribution to sculpture as a field.

The sculpture grant is specifically for an artist who demonstrates an exceptional commitment to sculpture that includes an informed and imaginative engagement with its materials, histories, and situation.

The writing grant is specifically for a writer who generates fresh writing and thinking on the history, aesthetics, purposes, imagination or situation of sculpture.

title_en: May PleinAir Salon Online Art Competition
excerpt_en: The 15th Annual PleinAir Salon is an online art competition with 11 monthly cycles, and is open to a variety of mediums and styles. It’s not just for ...
content_en:
The 15th Annual PleinAir Salon is an online art competition with 11 monthly cycles, and is open to a variety of mediums and styles. It’s not just for plein air painters! They invite a variety of top master artists, museum directors and gallery owners to judge each month. All monthly winners are automatically included in the Annual Competition where the Grand Prize winner receives $15,000 and has their painting featured on the cover of PleinAir Magazine, the #1 representational art magazine at Barnes & Noble.
In addition to over $50,000 in ALL Cash Prizes, winners receive exposure and recognition through our various magazines, websites, newsletters and social media platforms.
content_html:

They invite a variety of top master artists, museum directors and gallery owners to judge each month. All monthly winners are automatically included in the Annual Competition where the Grand Prize winner receives $15,000 and has their painting featured on the cover of PleinAir Magazine, the #1 representational art magazine at Barnes & Noble.

In addition to over $50,000 in ALL Cash Prizes, winners receive exposure and recognition through our various magazines, websites, newsletters and social media platforms.

excerpt_en: Building on the legacy of previous iterations, Jaipur Art Week Edition 5.0 launches an Open Call, inviting artists and creatives to share innovative p...
content_en: Building on the legacy of previous iterations, Jaipur Art Week Edition 5.0 launches an Open Call, inviting artists and creatives to share innovative proposals for new work that will encourage meaningful and open dialogue and collaboration. Selected artists will be given the opportunity to showcase their work in a group exhibition or as solo interventions across partner venues throughout Jaipur. The applicant's proposal can respond to one of the venues listed on the site, otherwise their team will support the artist through the curatorial process to find the right fit for their work.
content_html: Building on the legacy of previous iterations, Jaipur Art Week Edition 5.0 launches an Open Call, inviting artists and creatives to share innovative proposals for new work that will encourage meaningful and open dialogue and collaboration. Selected artists will be given the opportunity to showcase their work in a group exhibition or as solo interventions across partner venues throughout Jaipur. The applicant's proposal can respond to one of the venues listed on the site, otherwise their team will support the artist through the curatorial process to find the right fit for their work.

excerpt_en: c.r.e.t.a. rome organizes artist residencies for periods of 4 weeks in the spring, summer and fall. The 2024/25 residencies include a shared equipped ...
content_en: c.r.e.t.a. rome organizes artist residencies for periods of 4 weeks in the spring, summer and fall. The 2024/25 residencies include a shared equipped studio, some technical assistance, access to several electric kilns, advice on museums, galleries and sites in Rome and beyond. The residency fee does not include accommodation. A second residency site in the countryside of Rome is a particularly good option for collaborative projects and/or artists who want to bring their spouses/companions and/or young family (supplemental fee). Housing is included. Residents have a private studio and one-bedroom house. For ceramic artists, there is access to electric and gas kilns, with options for reduction firing.

A second residency site in the countryside of Rome is a particularly good option for collaborative projects and/or artists who want to bring their spouses/companions and/or young family (supplemental fee). Housing is included. Residents have a private studio and one-bedroom house. For ceramic artists, there is access to electric and gas kilns, with options for reduction firing.

excerpt_en: The Rothko Museum invites artists to apply to the “Mark Rothko 2025” International Painting Symposium – a vibrant creative forum organised in the muse...
content_en: The Rothko Museum invites artists to apply to the “Mark Rothko 2025” International Painting Symposium – a vibrant creative forum organised in the museum’s residency framework. Held annually in September for over twenty years, the symposium commemorates Mark Rothko’s birthday in his native town and puts Daugavpils in the spotlight as an inspiring hub for contemporary artistic practices where creativity can truly thrive. This internationally popular symposium is an inclusive platform for discussion and an opportunity for seeing and discovering a place with links to Rothko’s childhood, learning about Rothko’s background and experiencing his originals in the museum’s Rothko Room. 10 professional artists will take part. The selection will be competition-based, with the jury assessing submitted materials.

title_en: Landscape Painting Retreat in Acadia with Philip Frey
excerpt_en: Philip Frey and Schoodic Institute are pleased to offer a plein air painting retreat designed specifically for dedicated landscape painters. This retr...
content_en: Philip Frey and Schoodic Institute are pleased to offer a plein air painting retreat designed specifically for dedicated landscape painters. This retreat will provide an opportunity for participants to hone their skills, gain deeper knowledge of materials, and develop confidence in their creative abilities. Each day will start early with an on-site painting session, followed by an early afternoon demonstration and critique. Participants will have ample time to engage in painting, explore the surrounding area, or relax at their leisure. Meals and a daily cocktail hour will be provided in a communal setting, fostering social interaction among fellow artists.

Participants will have ample time to engage in painting, explore the surrounding area, or relax at their leisure. excerpt_en:
Fusion Art announces the Figures & Faces 2025 Art Competition.
For this competition, both 2D and 3D artists, worldwide, are invited to submit their be...
content_en:
Fusion Art announces the Figures & Faces 2025 Art Competition.

All artists, regardless of location or experience, are invited to submit their best representational and/or abstract art and photography. This is the 11th annual Figures & Faces art competition that gallery has held.

excerpt_en: The Larch Creative Fund, in conjunction with the Spruill Center for the Arts, is seeking project proposals for innovative projects that encourage crea...
content_en:
The Larch Creative Fund, in conjunction with the Spruill Center for the Arts, is seeking project proposals for innovative projects that encourage creative and critical thinking through the arts, with a focus on having fun and encouraging community participation and related activities. Grant funding will be awarded commensurate with the project scope and impact, in amounts determined at the discretion of the jury committee.
Preference will be given to projects that:
Engage or involve the broader public and encourage social engagement
Are free and accessible to a diverse audience
Are new projects to the artist/organization submitting the proposal
Proposals for projects must be arts based and are eligible for funding for the project to take place in the state of Georgia.
content_html:
The Larch Creative Fund, in conjunction with the Spruill Center for the Arts, is seeking project proposals for innovative projects that encourage creative and critical thinking through the arts, with a focus on having fun and encouraging community participation and related activities. Grant funding will be awarded commensurate with the project scope and impact, in amounts determined at the discretion of the jury committee.

Preference will be given to projects that:
Engage or involve the broader public and encourage social engagement
Are free and accessible to a diverse audience
Are new projects to the artist/organization submitting the proposal
Proposals for projects must be arts based and are eligible for funding for the project to take place in the state of Georgia.

title_en: Artist in Residence Program - A to Z Wineworks
excerpt_en: A to Z Wineworks, located at their REX HILL property in Oregon’s Willamette Valley, seeks an Artist in Residence for a term beginning in Fall 2025 wit...
content_en:
A to Z Wineworks, located at their REX HILL property in Oregon’s Willamette Valley, seeks an Artist in Residence for a term beginning in Fall 2025 with a harvest experience and ending in Fall 2026.
The A to Z Artist in Residence immersion program follows the natural cycle of a vintage from pre-harvest through bottling, observing and participating in the art of winemaking. The artist begins as a paid harvest intern. After harvest, the Artist in Residence works on their individual art while remaining involved in the life of the winery as the wine moves from grapes to glass. The residency concludes with a public showcase of some of the artist’s work through a gallery showing, lecture, reading and/or performance.
content_html:
A to Z Wineworks, located at their REX HILL property in Oregon’s Willamette Valley, seeks an Artist in Residence for a term beginning in Fall 2025 with a harvest experience and ending in Fall 2026.

The A to Z Artist in Residence immersion program follows the natural cycle of a vintage from pre-harvest through bottling, observing and participating in the art of winemaking. The artist begins as a paid harvest intern. After harvest, the Artist in Residence works on their individual art while remaining involved in the life of the winery as the wine moves from grapes to glass. The residency concludes with a public showcase of some of the artist’s work through a gallery showing, lecture, reading and/or performance.

A-year-long exhibition that exposures at the DIPF Festival - inclusion in art magazine, any related press where the works viewed by an international panel of influential experts in the field of photography.

title_en: BFA Paid Mural Mentorship in LBTS, FL
excerpt_en: Business for the Arts Broward (BFA) is partnering with Florida Purchasing Agency on a mural mentorship for their building. The mural mentorship projec...
content_en: Business for the Arts Broward (BFA) is partnering with Florida Purchasing Agency on a mural mentorship for their building. The mural mentorship project in Lauderdale by the Sea, FL aims to create a vibrant and visually striking mural under the guidance of Lead Artist Lori Pratico in partnership with BFA, funded by Wayne and Lucretia Weiner, Florida Purchasing Agency and BBX Capital. Lori Pratico brings over 30 years of experience and creativity to the initiative. This collaborative endeavor will involve five mentee artists, providing them with the opportunity to build their mural skills and gain valuable insights into the process of creating murals. Throughout the project, the mentees will work closely with Lori Pratico, their mentor, participating in brainstorming sessions, design development, and the execution of the mural itself.
content_html: Business for the Arts Broward (BFA) is partnering with Florida Purchasing Agency on a mural mentorship for their building. The mural mentorship project in Lauderdale by the Sea, FL aims to create a vibrant and visually striking mural under the guidance of Lead Artist Lori Pratico in partnership with BFA, funded by Wayne and Lucretia Weiner, Florida Purchasing Agency and BBX Capital. Lori Pratico brings over 30 years of experience and creativity to the initiative. This collaborative endeavor will involve five mentee artists, providing them with the opportunity to build their mural skills and gain valuable insights into the process of creating murals. Throughout the project, the mentees will work closely with Lori Pratico, their mentor, participating in brainstorming sessions, design development, and the execution of the mural itself.

excerpt_en: /rəˈzɪst(ə)n(t)s/ a juried call for photography that represents, express or documents resistance, seen or unseen. Open to all photo-based work with no...
content_en: /rəˈzɪst(ə)n(t)s/ a juried call for photography that represents, express or documents resistance, seen or unseen. Open to all photo-based work with no limit on subject matter or technique. Entries will be judged individually. They are looking to assemble a gallery exhibition, to explore, express and document resistance. Beyond the requirement that light was captured somewhere in the process of making of your work, there are no limits to the type of resistance you choose to represent.

title_en: Hands OFF with Hands ON Art
excerpt_en: Put your hands on art and let your voice be heard at Kehler Liddell Gallery’s Juried Summer Small Works show. Inspired by the Hands Off movement, Kehl...
content_en: Put your hands on art and let your voice be heard at Kehler Liddell Gallery’s Juried Summer Small Works show. Inspired by the Hands Off movement, Kehler Liddell Gallery invites you to express yourself through art. A community comes together through art. Let it all out on canvas, paper, stone, metal, photography, and more. Hands OFF – Hands On Art will be a juried exhibition of small works to be shown at Kehler Liddell Gallery in New Haven, Connecticut taking place in Summer 2025. There will be an opening reception July 13, 2025 from 2-5pm with an opportunity for artist discussion in additional to regularly held events and open hours at KLG.

content_en: Heartland Art Club is proud to announce RepreSENSATIONAL 2025, a national exhibition celebrating the finest in representational art from across the United States. They invite artists from the Continental U.S. to submit their work for a chance to be part of this exciting exhibition, which will be held at our gallery in St. Louis, Missouri, and online from August 13, 2025 - October 4, 2025. With over $9,000 in prizes to be awarded, this is an outstanding opportunity for artists to showcase their talent and gain national recognition.

title_en: Fellowship: MOCA GA - Working Artist Project
excerpt_en: The Working Artist Project (WAP) is a year-long fellowship program facilitated by The Museum of Contemporary Art of Georgia (MOCA GA). The program was...
content_en: The Working Artist Project (WAP) is a year-long fellowship program facilitated by The Museum of Contemporary Art of Georgia (MOCA GA). The program was created by MOCA GA to champion established visual artists of merit who are based in the Atlanta metropolitan region. Each year, a guest curator selects three of our best and brightest to receive a solo exhibition, promotion, a studio apprentice (in support of emerging artists in the Atlanta Community), a full-color catalogue, and a $15,000 stipend to create work over the course of the year.
content_html: The Working Artist Project (WAP) is a year-long fellowship program facilitated by The Museum of Contemporary Art of Georgia (MOCA GA). The program was created by MOCA GA to champion established visual artists of merit who are based in the Atlanta metropolitan region. Each year, a guest curator selects three of our best and brightest to receive a solo exhibition, promotion, a studio apprentice (in support of emerging artists in the Atlanta Community), a full-color catalogue, and a $15,000 stipend to create work over the course of the year.

title_en: Call for Autumn Retreat 2025 – ARiR Guiniguada, Gran Canaria
excerpt_en: Artist and Researcher in Residence Guiniguada is awaiting guests who have projects or would want to get a deeper understanding of the following issues...
content_en: Artist and Researcher in Residence Guiniguada is awaiting guests who have projects or would want to get a deeper understanding of the following issues: Ecology & society: ecological art, food chain, carbon and nitrogen cycle, recuperation of ecosystems. Arts & society: visual language, contemporary art of light, hermetic traditions in modern art. Human rights & society: equality of opportunity, equal treatment, social exclusion/inclusion. General facilities / services: large outdoor and indoor spaces, large work desks, large work walls, library, abundance of organic material, basic wood and metal working electric tools, basic manual stone working tools, manual gardening, landscaping tools, collection of international and Canarian fresh herbs for cooking and tea. Duration of residency —Preferably either 4 weeks: 10 September-8 October OR 8 October-5 November; OR the whole 8 weeks period. Minimum stay 2 weeks.

title_en: Farm Studio India – International Artist Residency, Rajasthan,...
excerpt_en: This is for an upcoming call for artists to attend Farm Studio in January and February 2026. Farm Studio International Artist Residency is located in ...
content_en: This is for an upcoming call for artists to attend Farm Studio in January and February 2026. Farm Studio International Artist Residency is located in a rural community in India. Residents stay and create in a quiet art centre and beautiful environment where they can develop their artwork free from accustomed distractions. There, collaboration and experimentation is encouraged. Relationships form between the artists coming from different countries and varied social, cultural, and artistic backgrounds. Many exciting exchanges and dialogues among artists take place, including scheduled artist talks, presentations, works in progress showings, exhibitions, etc. Farm Studio also promotes and celebrates the local community’s artistic and cultural identity while also introducing art and culture of others’ (Indian and International guests) back to the community.

Residents stay and create in a quiet art centre and beautiful environment where they can develop their artwork free from accustomed distractions. There, collaboration and experimentation is encouraged. Relationships form between the artists coming from different countries and varied social, cultural, and artistic backgrounds. Many exciting exchanges and dialogues among artists take place, including scheduled artist talks, presentations, works in progress showings, exhibitions, etc. Farm Studio also promotes and celebrates the local community’s artistic and cultural identity while also introducing art and culture of others’ (Indian and International guests) back to the community.

title_en: Sculpture in the Valley - Kangaroo Valley
excerpt_en: Sculpture in the Valley submissions now open, closing 1 June. $25K+ in prizes. Arts in the Valley is a community organisation, umbrella for three type...
content_en: Sculpture in the Valley submissions now open, closing 1 June. $25K+ in prizes. Arts in the Valley is a community organisation, umbrella for three types of events conducted in the historic village of Kangaroo Valley – music, Visual Arts and Sculpture in the Valley. It typically shows off some large-scale and thrilling sculptures viewed against a scenic backdrop. Small scale works are also on show, this time within a re-purposed heritage cow shed. There is a competition with non-acquisitive prizes. The sculptures are available for sale and: “yes, commissions occur”. Sculpture in the Valley 2025 will be held again on private acreage. Two adjoining properties have been chosen and they sit alongside Barrengarry Creek with marvellous views of the soaring sandstone escarpments for which the valley is known.

Arts in the Valley is a community organisation, umbrella for three types of events conducted in the historic village of Kangaroo Valley – music, Visual Arts and Sculpture in the Valley. It typically shows off some large-scale and thrilling sculptures viewed against a scenic backdrop. Small scale works are also on show, this time within a re-purposed heritage cow shed. There is a competition with non-acquisitive prizes. The sculptures are available for sale and: “yes, commissions occur”. Sculpture in the Valley 2025 will be held again on private acreage. Two adjoining properties have been chosen and they sit alongside Barrengarry Creek with marvellous views of the soaring sandstone escarpments for which the valley is known.

title_en: Call for EOIs for laneway public art projects in City of Subia...
excerpt_en: The City of Subiaco is seeking artists creating functional or utilitarian public artwork. This might be lighting, seating, shade, art utilising living...
content_en: The City of Subiaco is seeking artists creating functional or utilitarian public artwork. This might be lighting, seating, shade, art utilising living plants – or any artwork serving both a practical and aesthetic use. It is important the artwork be robust, able to endure outdoors long term in WA’s high UV, windy conditions. The City of Subiaco is undertaking a number of laneway upgrades in the coming years and would like to identify a pool of artists who may wish to collaborate with their landscape designers and staff on relevant projects as they arise. They are open to working with artists based nationally, where budget allows.

It is important the artwork be robust, able to endure outdoors long term in WA’s high UV, windy conditions. The City of Subiaco is undertaking a number of laneway upgrades in the coming years and would like to identify a pool of artists who may wish to collaborate with their landscape designers and staff on relevant projects as they arise. They are open to working with artists based nationally, where budget allows.

title_en: Creative Kitchen - Micro Funding for Collaborative Creative Pr...
excerpt_en: This community audience driven initiative seeks to support new creative collaborations by providing micro funding to help kick start your project. In ...
content_en: This community audience driven initiative seeks to support new creative collaborations by providing micro funding to help kick start your project. In the Creative Kitchen, the audience has the power, so make sure you bring you fan club and your creative ideas along to this fun networking evening! On the night, artists will pitch and the audience will vote. The vote will determine who is awarded $1000 to push their idea towards realisation. This fun networking opportunity aims to get creative juices cooking. The bar will be open (so you can buy influence with voters) and any donations made on the night will also be given to the winner. Pop it in your diary and pop on your thinking caps. Technical experimentation, recordings, mural painting, community workshops, art events, live performances – nothing is off the table.

In the Creative Kitchen, the audience has the power, so make sure you bring you fan club and your creative ideas along to this fun networking evening! This fun networking opportunity aims to get creative juices cooking. The bar will be open (so you can buy influence with voters) and any donations made on the night will also be given to the winner. Pop it in your diary and pop on your thinking caps. Technical experimentation, recordings, mural painting, community workshops, art events, live performances – nothing is off the table.

excerpt_en: The Wassaic Project accepts proposals for their 2026 Residency program, which includes the Winter Residency program (Jan – April 2026) and the Summer ...
content_en: The Wassaic Project accepts proposals for their 2026 Residency program, which includes the Winter Residency program (Jan – April 2026) and the Summer Residency program (June – September 2026). This call is for individual artists, collaborative teams, groups of two or more individual artists, and artists applying through their Family Residency program. The residency fee is $900 (the fee is per artist/collab group/artist team/family). The fees cover: semi-private studio space(s), private room in a shared house (our Family program receives a private house), access to our wood shop, print shop, and kiln, staff support, and programming such as their visiting artist program, artist talks, studio visits, open studios, artist presentations, etc.
content_html: The Wassaic Project accepts proposals for their 2026 Residency program, which includes the Winter Residency program (Jan – April 2026) and the Summer Residency program (June – September 2026). This call is for individual artists, collaborative teams, groups of two or more individual artists, and artists applying through their Family Residency program. The residency fee is $900 (the fee is per artist/collab group/artist team/family). The fees cover: semi-private studio space(s), private room in a shared house (our Family program receives a private house), access to our wood shop, print shop, and kiln, staff support, and programming such as their visiting artist program, artist talks, studio visits, open studios, artist presentations, etc.

title_en: Wassaic Project 2025 Haunted Mill Open Call
excerpt_en: Get ready to bring your zaniest, spookiest ideas to life! They’re calling all artists to apply for a fully funded 1-5 week residency to participate in...
content_en:
Get ready to bring your zaniest, spookiest ideas to life! They’re calling all artists to apply for a fully funded 1-5 week residency to participate in the 2025 Wassaic Project Haunted Mill! The Haunted Mill will be open to the public 4:00 PM - 7:00 PM on October 24th, October 25th, and October 26th, 2025.
Haunted Mill artists will have access to housing in one of their residency houses for 1 - 5 weeks between October 1st to November 3rd, 2025, private studio space in Maxon Mills, and additional space in the Luther Barn. They’re offering $500 - $800 honorariums (depending on the scope of the project) to participating artists and artistic teams for your hard work and creativity.
content_html:
Get ready to bring your zaniest, spookiest ideas to life! They’re calling all artists to apply for a fully funded 1-5 week residency to participate in the 2025 Wassaic Project Haunted Mill! The Haunted Mill will be open to the public 4:00 PM - 7:00 PM on October 24th, October 25th, and October 26th, 2025.

Haunted Mill artists will have access to housing in one of their residency houses for 1 - 5 weeks between October 1st to November 3rd, 2025, private studio space in Maxon Mills, and additional space in the Luther Barn. They’re offering $500 - $800 honorariums (depending on the scope of the project) to participating artists and artistic teams for your hard work and creativity.

excerpt_en:
The purpose of this call is to develop a pre-qualified list of mosaic artists for potential public art projects within the Town of Addison.
Scope of P...
content_en:
The purpose of this call is to develop a pre-qualified list of mosaic artists for potential public art projects within the Town of Addison.
Scope of Potential Projects:
•	Large and small mosaic panels designed for outdoor walls or building facades.
•	2D and 3D mosaic sculptures of animals, flora, trees, or other landscape features for placement along trails or within parks
•	An initial project is for a 3-section wall approximately 6 ft. high (the “Initial Project”).
Each wall section is approximately 8 ft. wide with an available area of up to 4 ft. x 5 ft. for each mosaic panel. There is a pond, walking path and landscape area near the wall. Selected artists would have the discretion to propose designs appropriate for each panel.
content_html:
The purpose of this call is to develop a pre-qualified list of mosaic artists for potential public art projects within the Town of Addison.
Scope of Potential Projects:
• Large and small mosaic panels designed for outdoor walls or building facades.
• 2D and 3D mosaic sculptures of animals, flora, trees, or other landscape features for placement along trails or within parks
• An initial project is for a 3-section wall approximately 6 ft. high (the “Initial Project”). Each wall section is approximately 8 ft. wide with an available area of up to 4 ft. x 5 ft. for each mosaic panel. There is a pond, walking path and landscape area near the wall. Selected artists would have the discretion to propose designs appropriate for each panel.

title_en: 29th Parkside National Print Exhibition Call for Entries
excerpt_en: 2025 marks the 29th presentation of the Parkside National Print Exhibition over thirty years since the first show opened at UW-Parkside. For three dec...
content_en: 2025 marks the 29th presentation of the Parkside National Print Exhibition over thirty years since the first show opened at UW-Parkside. For three decades, the PNPE has shown some of the finest examples of original prints from artists nationwide. It is one of the longest-running competitive print exhibitions in the Midwest; founded at UW-Parkside in 1987 by printmaking professor Doug DeVinny. This tradition continues without size limitations in the Emile H. Mathis Gallery in the Rita Tallent Picken Regional Center for Arts & Humanities at the University of Wisconsin-Parkside. The exhibition will take place Aug 19- Nov 21, 2025, including a public reception, announcement of awards, and juror’s remarks on Wed, Sep 10, 4-6 PM. A full-color catalog will accompany this exhibition.
content_html: 2025 marks the 29th presentation of the Parkside National Print Exhibition over thirty years since the first show opened at UW-Parkside. For three decades, the PNPE has shown some of the finest examples of original prints from artists nationwide. It is one of the longest-running competitive print exhibitions in the Midwest; founded at UW-Parkside in 1987 by printmaking professor Doug DeVinny. This tradition continues without size limitations in the Emile H. Mathis Gallery in the Rita Tallent Picken Regional Center for Arts & Humanities at the University of Wisconsin-Parkside. The exhibition will take place Aug 19- Nov 21, 2025, including a public reception, announcement of awards, and juror’s remarks on Wed, Sep 10, 4-6 PM. A full-color catalog will accompany this exhibition.

excerpt_en: In Cahoots Residency provides housing and studio space to both emerging and professional artists with a focus on artists books, letterpress, printmaki...
content_en: In Cahoots Residency provides housing and studio space to both emerging and professional artists with a focus on artists books, letterpress, printmaking, writing and collaboration. The residency hosts from 3 to 5 artists for sessions ranging from one to three weeks long. Residents are provided housing: 3 full guest houses (with kitchens and full bathrooms), and 2 summer sleeping cottages (with a shared kitchen and full bathroom). Residents have 24-hour access to the shared visual art studios or the individual writing studio. Residents do their own cooking. For those without a car, rides to the grocery store/supply store and weekly group field trips (to places such as downtown Petaluma or the Pacific coast) are provided free of charge.

The residency hosts from 3 to 5 artists for sessions ranging from one to three weeks long. Residents are provided housing: 3 full guest houses (with kitchens and full bathrooms), and 2 summer sleeping cottages (with a shared kitchen and full bathroom). Residents have 24-hour access to the shared visual art studios or the individual writing studio. Residents do their own cooking. For those without a car, rides to the grocery store/supply store and weekly group field trips (to places such as downtown Petaluma or the Pacific coast) are provided free of charge.
